meanings.definition: To incline or bend from a vertical position
meanings.sent1: She had to lean against the wall to catch her breath.
meanings.sent2: The tower started to lean slightly after the earthquake.
meanings.sent3: The tree seemed to lean over as if trying to listen to the conversation below.
meanings.sent4: His decision to lean towards a career in music surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The old house leaned towards the river, its foundation worn away by time.

meanings.sent1: I lean on my friends for support during tough times.
meanings.sent2: She knew she could always lean on her sister for help.
meanings.sent3: The team had to lean heavily on their captain for guidance.
meanings.sent4: In times of need, we often lean on our faith for strength.
meanings.sent5: He had to lean on his experience to make the right decision.

meanings.definition: Lacking in richness, fullness, or strength
meanings.sent1: The soup had a lean flavor, needing more seasoning.
meanings.sent2: The budget was lean this year, so we had to cut back on expenses.
meanings.sent3: The story felt a bit lean without enough details to engage the reader.
meanings.sent4: The lean harvest meant there would be less food for the winter.
meanings.sent5: His lean muscles showed the result of his hard work at the gym.

meanings.definition: To be in a position that is not perpendicular to the ground
meanings.sent1: The tower seemed to lean towards the setting sun.
meanings.sent2: The old fence started to lean to one side due to strong winds.
meanings.sent3: The tired hiker had to lean forward to keep walking up the steep hill.
meanings.sent4: The tree began to lean over the fence, creating a natural archway.
meanings.sent5: The building appeared to lean slightly, giving it a unique and quirky look.
